drupalNodeEvent.title: Mind the Gap: Analytical Challenges to Studying China’s or Any Other Country’s Influence

field_organizers.processed: Department of Politics and Public Administration, University of Hong Kong

field_description.processed: You are cordially invited to join us for the Contemporary China Research Cluster Public Lecture - Mind the Gap: Analytical Challenges to Studying China’s or Any Other Country’s Influence. In this lecture, Professor Chan will present cautionary remarks and illustrative examples suggesting that the determination of a country’s influence abroad is far more challenging than the familiar claims we often encounter in the news media and even some scholarly publications. Concerns for making valid inference are no less apposite or compelling for studying China’s international influence as for that of other countries. The analytical issues he raises in this lecture are thus generic and not peculiar to the study of China.
